clinical_study.brief_title: Brazilian Intervention to Increase Evidence Usage in Practice - Stroke ( BRIDGE-Stroke)
clinical_study.official_title: A Cluster Randomized Trial to Evaluate the Increase in Usage of Evidence-based Practices for Stroke Treatment Using a Multifaceted Strategy

brief_summary.textblock:
Phase 1: An observational study ( registry) will be conducted with the objective of documenting the practice of stroke treatment in brazilian and latin american hospitals.
Phase 2: A cluster randomized trial aiming to evaluate the effect of a multifaceted strategy to increase evidence based treatments usage for stroke patients. The hospitals will be randomized into two groups: the multifaceted strategy group and the usual care group.

detailed_description.textblock:
Study Objective: The purpose of this study is to evaluate a multifaceted strategy to increase evidence based therapies for patients with acute ischemic stroke.
Study Population; Patients with suspected stroke or transient ischemic attack (TIA) with symptoms lasting up to 24h hours.
Quality Improvement Multifaceted Intervention: The strategy includes a simulation based team training, case manager, check lists, reminders and educational material.

primary_outcome.description: For phase 1 : Will be measured frequency of evidence based strategies usage according to pre-specified quality measures indicators ( prescription of thrombolytic therapy, antithrombotics, depp venous thromboembolism prophylaxy, lipid lowering drugs and anticoagulants) in all hospitals.

For phase 2: Will be measured the proportion of patients that receive all pre-specified evidence based strategies for which they are candidate in the first 48 hours of stroke (prescription of thrombolytic therapy, antithrombotics, deep venous thromboembolism prophylaxy)

secondary_outcome.description: Adherence to evidence based discharge prescription
Number of patients presenting a new stroke in 30 days
Measured by modified Rankin scale (mRankin). The proportion of patients with a mRankin of 0 to 2 ( considered as a good clinical outcome) will be compared between the two groups

arm_group.description: Multifaceted Intervention Simulation Based Team Training Case Manager Check lists Reminders Educational Materials

intervention.description: Simulation Based Team Training Case Manager: a trained person who works in the hospital and is responsible for ensuring the usage of all interventions Reminders - Check lists - decision support algorithm Distribution of educational materials: guidelines and recommendations for best practices

criteria.textblock:
Patient Eligibility Criteria
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with suspect stroke or TIA lasting for up to 24 hours
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with intracranial hemorrhage, CNS infection , CNS tumor
Cluster Eligibility Criteria
Inclusion Criteria:
- hospitals with a emergency department, with available tomography, neurologist and alteplase
Exclusion Criteria:
- hospitals that don't provide Institutional Authorization Form
